title: Champions with One shot potential > Other Champs?
body:
So this is just a broad question on league of legends,

Are Champions that have One shot potentials better than those who don't? For example :

Take a champion like {{champion:131}} Diana, who can easily one shot someone Mid-Late game. Then, take another champion like {{champion:61}}  Orianna, who does damage, but can't one shot like Diana does. In this sense, is it right to say Diana is a stronger champ than Orianna? is it right to say she brings more to her team, or is there more to it?

If the answer is Yes, (Diana is technically a stronger champion than Orianna), does that mean a team a team that picks 5 champions that can one-shot will be more superior to a team that picks champions like Orianna, Elise, Morgana, etc. Please Elaborate :)

replies.body:
First of all, orianna can one-shot people. Secondly, tanks exist for a reason. Thirdly, league isn't all about killing enemies and doing damage.
You make a team of burst champs, and then cry as you get ripped apart by juggernauts and completely stopped by cc.
Thanks for clearing it up for me. I've gotten the hang of one shotting with diana, haven't seen it happen with ori yet but time will tell :)

In the right situation using her ult, oriana can 1 shot not just a single target like diana, but an entire team. Orianna is often one of the most common key damage sources in wombo combos, others being mf ,malphite, ect...

i've played with an amazing orianna on my team i was playing top lane, and im like oh ok ill roam mid, i come and i just watch the enemy rengar AND the swain both get one shot in the space of about 10 seconds. I turned around and walked the other way, i wasnt needed there.

Overall if depends on your play style, many "1-shot" champs are usually assassins such as {{champion:107}} , {{champion:238}} , {{champion:55}}  to name a few. But lets say you want to teamfight, probably someone like {{champion:61}} or {{champion:268}} would be of more help overall than the 
"1-shotters". 

"1-shot" champs take skill, but usually can only take 1 person down, which would be a high priority target like the adc or ap carry but than lack the damage or abilities (as their on cooldown) to do anything else. (apart from {{champion:55}} ).

So to answer you question, it depends on the scenario, of you are doing a 1v1, one shots would probably be better, (unless "1-shot" vs tank), a jungle skirmish, one shots again. But of your doing an open 5v5 teamfight in the midlane, a fighter or mage would probably be more beneficial to the team as a whole.
